page.title: 01S.E. OUTSKIRTS OF SWINDON
page.content: The landscape is mainly clay running up to a chalk ridge in the south of the block. The northern half of the block consists of the outskirts of Swindon and many of the amenities of the town such as a golf course and recreation ground, with Coate Water offering fishing, sailing and nature reserve. Running along the foot of the chalk ridge the M4 motorway dominates the centre of the block and together with the interchange with A419 trunk road forms present limit to Swindon expansion. South of the motorway the land rises steeply to the Marlborough Downs with villages of Badbury, Chiseldon and Hodson established on the spring line. Except for the small number employed in farming most of the working population commute into or around Swindon. The largest employers are the Consulting Engineers,
